standard_metadata.standard_description: Recognize that in a multi-digit whole number, a digit in one place represents ten times what it represents in the place to its right.

hints.content: When multiplying by $10$, we shift our numbers $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $17$| |$\swarrow\blueD{1}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{7}$   $10 \times 17$ |$?$ |$?$ | $?$
Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $17$| |$\swarrow\blueD{1}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{7}$   $10 \times 17$ |$\blueD1$ |$\greenD7$ | $0$
$10 \times \blueD1\greenD7 = \blueD1\green70$

When multiplying by $10$, we shift our numbers $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $30$| |$\swarrow\blueD{3}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$   $10 \times 30$ |$?$ |$?$ | $?$
Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $30$| |$\swarrow\blueD{3}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$   $10 \times 30$ |$\blueD3$ |$\greenD0$ | $0$
$ \blueD3\green00=10 \times \blueD3\greenD0 $

When multiplying by $10$, we shift our numbers $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $89$| |$\swarrow\blueD{8}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{9}$   $89 \times 10$ |$?$ |$?$ | $?$
Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $89$| |$\swarrow\blueD{8}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{9}$   $89 \times 10$ |$\blueD8$ |$\greenD9$ | $0$
$\blueD8\greenD9 \times 10  = \blueD8\green90$

When multiplying by $10$, we shift our numbers $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $296$| |$\swarrow\blueD{2}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{9}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{6}$   $296 \times 10$ | $?$ | $?$ |$?$ | $?$

Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $296$| |$\swarrow\blueD{2}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{9}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{6}$ $296 \times 10$ | $\blueD{2}$ | $\greenD{9}$ |$\purpleD{6}$ | $0$
$\blueD2{,}\greenD9\purpleD60=\blueD2\greenD9\purpleD6\times 10$

When multiplying by $10$, we shift our numbers $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $300$| |$\swarrow\blueD{3}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$   $10 \times 300$ | $?$ | $?$ |$?$ | $?$

Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $300$| |$\swarrow\blueD{3}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$ $10 \times 300$ | $\blueD{3}$ | $\greenD{0}$ |$\purpleD{0}$ | $0$
$10 \times\blueD3\greenD0\purpleD0=\blueD3{,}\greenD0\purpleD00$

When multiplying by $10$, we shift our numbers $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $450$| |$\swarrow\blueD{4}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{5}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$   $450 \times 10$ | $?$ | $?$ |$?$ | $?$

Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $450$| |$\swarrow\blueD{4}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{5}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$ $450 \times 10$ | $\blueD{4}$ | $\greenD{5}$ |$\purpleD{0}$ | $0$
$\blueD4{,}\greenD5\purpleD00=\blueD4\greenD5\purpleD0\times 10$

When multiplying by $10$, we shift our numbers $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $506$| |$\swarrow\blueD{5}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{6}$   $10 \times 506$ | $?$ | $?$ |$?$ | $?$

Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $506$| |$\swarrow\blueD{5}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{6}$ $10 \times 506$ | $\blueD{5}$ | $\greenD{0}$ |$\purpleD{6}$ | $0$
$10\times \blueD5\greenD0\purpleD6=\blueD5{,}\greenD0\purpleD60$

When multiplying by $10$, we shift our numbers $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-:  $2{,}700$| |$\swarrow\maroonD{2}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{7}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$   $10 \times 2{,}700$ | $?$ | $?$ |$?$ | $?$ | $?$

Number | Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-:  $2{,}700$| |$\swarrow\maroonD{2}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{7}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$   $10 \times 2{,}700$ | $\maroonD{2}$ | $\blueD{7}$ |$\greenD{0}$ | $\purpleD{0}$ | $0$
$\maroonD2\blueD7{,}\greenD0\purpleD00 = 10 \times \maroonD2{,}\blueD7\greenD0\purpleD0$

When multiplying by $10$, we shift our numbers $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-:  $3{,}140$| |$\swarrow\maroonD{3}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{1}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{4}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$   $10 \times 3{,}140$ | $?$ | $?$ |$?$ | $?$ | $?$

Number | Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-:  $3{,}140$| |$\swarrow\maroonD{3}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{1}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{4}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$   $10 \times 3{,}140$ | $\maroonD{3}$ | $\blueD{1}$ |$\greenD{4}$ | $\purpleD{0}$ | $0$
$10 \times \maroonD3{,}\blueD1\greenD4\purpleD0=\maroonD3\blueD1{,}\greenD4\purpleD00$

When multiplying by $10$, we shift our numbers $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-:  $4{,}630$| |$\swarrow\maroonD{4}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{6}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{3}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$   $4{,}630 \times 10$ | $?$ | $?$ |$?$ | $?$ | $?$

Number | Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-:  $4{,}630$| |$\swarrow\maroonD{4}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{6}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{3}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$   $4{,}630 \times 10$ | $\maroonD{4}$ | $\blueD{6}$ |$\greenD{3}$ | $\purpleD{0}$ | $0$
$\maroonD4\blueD6{,}\greenD3\purpleD00 = \maroonD4{,}\blueD6\greenD3\purpleD0 \times 10$

When multiplying by $10$, we shift our numbers $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-:  $7{,}170$| |$\swarrow\maroonD{7}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{1}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{7}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$   $7{,}170 \times 10$ | $?$ | $?$ |$?$ | $?$ | $?$

Number | Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-:  $7{,}170$| |$\swarrow\maroonD{7}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{1}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{7}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$   $7{,}170 \times 10$ | $\maroonD{7}$ | $\blueD{1}$ |$\greenD{7}$ | $\purpleD{0}$ | $0$
$\maroonD7{,}\blueD1\greenD7\purpleD0 \times 10 = \maroonD7\blueD1{,}\greenD7\purpleD00 $

When multiplying by $10$, we shift our numbers $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Hundred Thousands | Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-: | :-:  $15{,}000$| |$\swarrow\goldD{1}$| $\swarrow\maroonD{5}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{0}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$   $15{,}000 \times 10$ | $?$ | $?$ |$?$ | $?$ | $?$ | $?$

Number | Hundred Thousands | Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-: | :-:  $15{,}000$| |$\swarrow\goldD{1}$| $\swarrow\maroonD{5}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{0}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$   $15{,}000 \times 10$ |$\swarrow\goldD{1}$| $\swarrow\maroonD{5}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{0}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$ | $0$
$\goldD1\maroonD5\blueD0{,}\greenD0\purpleD00 = \goldD1\maroonD5{,}\blueD0\greenD0\purpleD0 \times 10$

When multiplying by $10$, we shift our numbers $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Hundred Thousands | Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-: | :-:  $28{,}400$| |$\swarrow\goldD{2}$| $\swarrow\maroonD{8}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{4}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$   $28{,}400 \times 10$ | $?$ | $?$ |$?$ | $?$ | $?$ | $?$

Number | Hundred Thousands | Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-: | :-:  $28{,}400$| |$\swarrow\goldD{2}$| $\swarrow\maroonD{8}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{4}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$   $28{,}400 \times 10$ |$\swarrow\goldD{2}$| $\swarrow\maroonD{8}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{4}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$ | $0$
$\goldD2\maroonD8{,}\blueD4\greenD0\purpleD0 \times 10=\goldD2\maroonD8\blueD4{,}\greenD0\purpleD00$

When multiplying by $10$, we shift our numbers $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Hundred Thousands | Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-: | :-:  $65{,}300$| |$\swarrow\goldD{6}$| $\swarrow\maroonD{5}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{3}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$   $10 \times 65{,}300$ | $?$ | $?$ |$?$ | $?$ | $?$ | $?$

Number | Hundred Thousands | Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-: | :-:  $65{,}300$| |$\swarrow\goldD{6}$| $\swarrow\maroonD{5}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{3}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$   $10 \times 65{,}300$ |$\swarrow\goldD{6}$| $\swarrow\maroonD{5}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{3}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$ | $0$
$\goldD6\maroonD5\blueD3{,}\greenD0\purpleD00=10 \times \goldD6\maroonD5{,}\blueD3\greenD0\purpleD0$

When multiplying by $10$, we shift our numbers $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Hundred Thousands | Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-: | :-:  $99{,}000$| |$\swarrow\goldD{9}$| $\swarrow\maroonD{9}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{0}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$   $10 \times 99{,}000$ | $?$ | $?$ |$?$ | $?$ | $?$ | $?$

Number | Hundred Thousands | Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-: | :-:  $99{,}000$| |$\swarrow\goldD{9}$| $\swarrow\maroonD{9}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{0}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$   $10 \times 99{,}000$ |$\swarrow\goldD{9}$| $\swarrow\maroonD{9}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{0}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{0}$ | $0$
$10 \times \goldD9\maroonD9{,}\blueD0\greenD0\purpleD0 = \goldD9\maroonD9\blueD0{,}\greenD0\purpleD00$
